newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: CIS buying sends tea prices up at Colombo auction.
newsitem.headline: CIS buying sends tea prices up at Colombo auction.

text.p: Forceful buying by the Commonwealth of Independent States (CIS), the biggest buyer of Sri Lankan tea, sent tea prices up across the board at the Colombo auction, brokers said on Wednesday.
"The CIS came in forcefully once again," said a broker. "Volumes are relatively small. So, when the CIS comes in strongly on low volumes they push prices up."
Brokers Forbes and Walker said the anticipated gross auction average price for the 4.3 million kg on offer should rise to 121.25 rupees ($2.13) per kg from 120.13 rupees last week.
Brokers said prices moved up in the latter part of the auction when buyers found they were short on low volumes.
Low volumes and sustained demand, especially from the CIS, have sent tea prices soaring in recent months.
The Colombo monthly tea auction average price rose to a record 117.85 rupees per kg in September from 108.63 rupees in August, Forbes and Walker said.
The next auction is on October 15-16 where 4.3 million kg will be on offer.
